skill.name: cobrapy
skill.description: Constraint-based metabolic modeling (COBRA). FBA, FVA, gene knockouts, flux sampling, SBML models, for systems biology and metabolic engineering analysis.
skill.summary: Constraint-based metabolic modeling (COBRA). FBA, FVA, gene knockouts, flux sampling, SBML models, f...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown files with COBRApy workflow examples. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands present. Pure instructional content for metabolic modeling.

content.value_statement: You need clear COBRApy workflows for metabolic modeling tasks. This skill provides structured examples for FBA, FVA, knockouts, sampling, and model handling.
actual_capabilities: Load and save models in SBML, JSON, YAML, and MATLAB formats
Run FBA, pFBA, and geometric FBA optimization workflows
Perform FVA with loopless and suboptimal flux range settings
Execute gene and reaction deletion studies for essentiality screens
Sample flux space and calculate production envelopes
limitations: Requires COBRApy package installed with compatible solver
Examples do not include model files
Some workflows require pandas and matplotlib dependencies
Results depend on model quality and constraint settings

use_cases.title: Predict growth phenotypes
use_cases.description: Use FBA and knockout screens to study growth effects in genome scale models.

use_cases.title: Design production strains
use_cases.description: Use production envelopes and gene knockouts to improve target metabolite yield.

use_cases.title: Validate model quality
use_cases.description: Check feasibility, mass balance, dead ends, and duplicates with validation workflows.

prompt_templates.title: First FBA run
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the ecoli model, run FBA, and summarize objective value, status, and top 10 fluxes.

prompt_templates.title: FVA at 90 percent
prompt_templates.prompt: Run FVA at 90 percent optimality and list the reactions with the widest flux ranges.

prompt_templates.title: Essential genes
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform single gene deletions and report genes with growth below 0.01.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced sampling
prompt_templates.prompt: Sample flux space with OptGP and summarize distributions for key glycolysis reactions.

output_examples.input: Analyze the ecoli model and identify reactions with the widest flux ranges at optimal growth.
output: Model optimization status is optimal with feasible growth
Highest range reactions include PFK, PGI, and ENO
Several exchange reactions show wide ranges due to medium bounds
Review bounds before sampling or production envelope analysis

best_practices: Use context managers to avoid permanent model changes
Check optimization status after each solve
Validate model feasibility with slim_optimize before deep analysis
anti_patterns: Assuming results are valid without checking solver status
Changing bounds without restoring original settings
Comparing results across models with inconsistent media

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, the workflows are tool agnostic and work across those platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It requires COBRApy and a solver installed, and results depend on model quality.

faq.question: Can I integrate my own SBML models?
faq.answer: Yes, the examples show how to load and save SBML models from files.

faq.question: Does it access or upload my data?
faq.answer: No, it is documentation only and does not transfer any data.

faq.question: What should I do if optimization fails?
faq.answer: Check medium bounds, reaction limits, and try a different solver like GLPK.

faq.question: How does this compare to general Python guides?
faq.answer: It is focused specifically on COBRApy workflows for metabolic modeling tasks.
